alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 9:40PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Randall, southeastern Oldham, eastern Deaf Smith and Potter Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 939 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Valley De Oro to 8 miles south of Buffalo Lake. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Automated weather equipment. At 930 PM CDT, automated weather equipment recorded a 52 mph gust in Hereford. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Hereford, Canyon, Lake Tanglewood, Buffalo Lake, Bushland, Valley De Oro, Umbarger, Wildorado, Palo Duro Canyon, Mescalero Park, Dawn, and Timbercreek Canyon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas.

area.areaDesc: Deaf Smith; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall
